intro: Eulophus peucedanoides, commonly known as the common cow-wheat, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Fabaceae. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and hedgerows. The plant features trifoliate leaves and produces small, pea-like flowers that are usually pale yellow to greenish in color. Its root system is fibrous and contributes to soil stabilization. Eulophus peucedanoides is also known for its historical use in traditional medicine.
